page.title: 01General Description.
page.content: The twelve kilometre block surveyed by our group is a rural area dominated by agriculture. It is situated near the south coast with the seaside towns of Eastbourne and Seaford being the nearest resorts (approximately 8 miles). The River Cuckmere winds through the south east corner of our area. Only one B road passes through the block and there are very few other roads, of the narrow and winding country lane type. These mainly supply farms and provide access to the small villages dotted about this region. The predominant sight which meets one's eyes is that of farmland - there is a fairly even distribution of both cereal and dairy farms. The most common crop grown within this area is grass. The main residential area is found towards the East in the small village of Upper Dicker.
